awd_abstract_narration: This research will investigate the question of whether it is                    better to pay attention to potentially unpleasant physical                      sensations or to try to distract from them.  Two basic questions                will be investigated:  (1) what are the possible costs of                       avoidant strategies?  and (2) what are the benefits of monitoring               strategies?  This study has both theoretical and practical                      importance.  Research on somatic interpretation has implications                for both basic psychological processes such as attention,                       selfregulation and bio-psychological interactions, and for                      clinical problems of medical care-seeking, compliance, and                      rehabilitation.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
org_div_long_name: Division of Behavioral and Cognitive Sciences
